result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory M Kreklow

defendant.name: Kreklow, Cory M
defendant.address: 1012 Shaw Court Apt #4,, c/o Tyree Evans, Whitewater, WI 53190

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge Weston from Defendant

Court's Response to Defendant's letter received 7-26-2016 : Mr. Kreklow - The Court  record in 16CM138 shows that the signature bond was signed the same date that it was ordered:6-14-2016. Also, 16CM138 was later dismissed. Therefore no legal basis exists to grant credit as you request. The time period you are referring to may have been applied to another case. In any event it its your trial lawyer's responsibility to get your proper credit. Please contact them. RRK

Courts response to Defendant's letter received 7-14-2016 : Mr. Kreklow, I don't know why the jail records apparently don't match the court records but you need to address this request to your attorney so that she can investigate and then bring the case back to court by Motion and Notice if neccessary. The judge is not allowed to give you legal advice or legal representation - RRK cc: all
from Defendant regarding no contact order

Cases 16CM138 & 16CM292 called together at 1:31 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled on Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond)
Defendant Cory M Kreklow in court, in-custody, with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on case 16CM292; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CM138
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statements by Katie Weber

On Case 16CM292, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence after the conditional jail time in Case 15CF344, the expected release date is 1/27/2017
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain employment and/or education program
--Batterer's Intervention Counseling
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--No Contact with Katie Weber unless she and Agent agree
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 1:53 pm
Motion hearing on July 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on July 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2016 at 09:40 am.
bond signed on 6/14/16; bond returned from JCSD on 6/15/16

Cases 16CM138, 16CM292, and 15CM330 called together at 3:32pm [mo]
Defendant Cory M Kreklow in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert .   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Dahnert appears specially on Cases 16CM138 & 16CM292.

As to Case 15CM330:
State has filed a Motion for Dismissal; no objection from Atty. Dahnert
The Court orders Case 15CM330 to be dismissed.

As to Cases 16CM138 and 16CM292, Initial Appearances occur:
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires a $500  signature bond in each case, with conditions: 
--no contact with Katie Weber
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

--no presence at the home or place of employment of Katie Weber
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores,
--take all prescriptions as prescribed


The Court orders that even shall this bond not be signed, Mr. Kreklow is to NOT have custody with Katie Weber. 

recess: 3:44pm


NEXT:  As to Cases 16CM138 & 16CM292: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/6/16 at 9:40am    (2)  Status Conference on 7/29/16 at 1:15pm
Initial appearance on June 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Cory M Kreklow
Current: 1012 Shaw Court Apt #4,, c/o Tyree Evans, Whitewater, WI 53190   (Effective: 05-10-2016)
Prior: 1012 Shaw Court Apt #4,, c/o Tyree Evans, Whitewater, WI

ADDRESS INFO for Cory M Kreklow
Current: 1012 Shaw Court Apt #4,, c/o Tyree Evans, Whitewater, WI   (Effective: 05-10-2016)
Prior: 314 S High Ave, Jefferson, WI 53549

[MK] During a hearing in Case 15CM330 today, Defendant Cory M Kreklow was in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie H Dahnert, and ADA Monica Hall was in court, appearing for the State of Wisconsin.   At the conclusion of the hearing there was a brief discussion about this new pending case #16CM138. The clerk provided Mr. Kreklow with a printed copy of the Criminal Complaint. Attorney Dahnert indicated that when Mr. Kreklow is released from the 30 Day Probation-related sanction term he is currently serving, his address will be:  c/o Tyree Evans, 1012 Shaw Court Apt #4, Whitewater WI 53190. The Court instructed Mr. Kreklow to request to meet at the Jail with the PD to apply for representation in the case. The Court indicated that the case should be scheduled for Initial Appearance in due course. 

NEXT:  schedule Initial Appearance, sending notice to Mr. Kreklow at both the Jail and at the new Whitewater address

[MK] case called at 9:52am. 
Defendant Cory M Kreklow not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall summarizes that Mr. Kreklow has open cases.  ADA Hall notes that Mr. Kreklow is currently on Probation.  
ADA Hall explains that the Summons & Complaint was emailed to Attorney Dahnert who has represented the Defendant on his other cases, however it was not mailed to Mr. Kreklow at the address on the Criminal Complaint because that is his parents' address, and it is known that he is not residing there.
On Motion of the State, the Court adjourns the hearing day to day pending service. 
recess 9:53am.
